org.platanios.learn.optimization

Class NonlinearConjugateGradientSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.AbstractIterativeSolver
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.AbstractLineSearchSolver
        • org.platanios.learn.optimization.NonlinearConjugateGradientSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Solver

    public final class NonlinearConjugateGradientSolver
extends AbstractLineSearchSolver
    These solvers are good for large scale problems and, on certain applications, competitive with limited-memory quasi-Newton methods as well.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Detail

      • method

        private final NonlinearConjugateGradientSolver.Method method
        Default value: If quadratic or linear function it is ExactLineSearch, otherwise it is StrongWolfeLineSearch with CONSERVE_FIRST_ORDER_CHANGE for the step size initialization method.

    • Method Detail

      • updateDirection

        public void updateDirection()
        Description copied from class: AbstractLineSearchSolver
        Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration. That means that when the new values are computed, new objects have to be instantiated for holding those values.
        Specified by:
        updateDirection in class AbstractLineSearchSolver

      • updatePoint

        public void updatePoint()
        Description copied from class: AbstractLineSearchSolver
        Note: Care must be taken when implementing this method because the previousDirection and the previousPoint variables are simply updated to point to currentDirection and currentPoint respectively, at the beginning of each iteration. That means that when the new values are computed, new objects have to be instantiated for holding those values.
        Specified by:
        updatePoint in class AbstractLineSearchSolver
